primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God the Son descends from eternity into the human condition (manger) to rescue humanity from a state of total inability and sin.

tekstueel_bewijs: Christ Jesus came into the world to save sinners.
He unrobed himself of garments of perpetual light.
He passes to us our royal birthright.
to make it well for my soul and for your soul
a new spirit put in us
The Son said to the Father... I come... to do thy will
Go, said the Father, and thy Father's blessings be on thy head
unto you is born this day... a Savior
it connects him with you and me, for we are sinners
A body hast thou prepared for me
The angels must have followed him down to earth and watched over him
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject, not merely a Helper.
helper.rol_van_geest: External help (Angelic/Providential) leading to internal change (New Spirit).

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin, Death, and Human Inability (The 'Heavy' Opponent)
tekstueel_bewijs: the shadow of the lynch rope
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just bad habits but a 'stony heart' and 'wickedness' that requires a divine descent to overcome.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: Human history as a series of births that either threaten (tyrants) or promise (reformers) the world.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: Human Babies (Hitler, King, Pasteur, etc.)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The human program is shown to be insufficient or ambiguous; the primary program (Christ) is the only one that provides the 'Savior' the human program lacks.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: God the Father → Salvation/New Heart → Sinful Humanity
actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: The Incarnation → Christ the Son ← Sin/Death/Stony Heart

voorbeelden_god_subject: He strips himself of the bright vestments.
He passes to us our royal birthright.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We are not able of ourselves to follow the road.

voorbeelden: we are not our own, but we belong to him
we have not had the strength... to act upon the best advice we already possess
we are not able of ourselves
one who can snatch us from the burning fire
gives to us authority over all devils

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on human impotence (lack of Pouvoir) and God's omnipotence. It rejects the idea that knowing (Savoir) or trying (Vouloir) is enough.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from the Hazard (~S2) and Threat (S2) of human birth to the inadequacy of Reform (~S1) to the absolute Grace (S1) of the Divine Birth.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by Christ taking on the 'body' (S2/Humanity) to grant the 'New Spirit' (S1).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; the mention of lynching and 'monstrous butchers' ensures S2 is not trivialized.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon explicitly denies human ability and places the entire weight of salvation on the action of the Son descending from the Father.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Mentioning Pasteur and King as 'promises' in the manger.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: It is not a leader we want most... we are not able of ourselves to follow the road.
He unrobed himself... he came down that we might go up.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Uses historical figures (King, Pasteur) to show the 'promise' of birth, but then pivots to show that even they are not 'Saviors.'
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides this: David is not the hero; the one born in David's city is the hero.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and awe; the burden of 'self-making' is removed.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic salvation; God does the work, man receives the benefit.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'hazard' of human birth to the 'certainty' of Christ's birth is masterfully handled.
spanning_punten: The tension between the 'good' human babies (King) and the 'bad' ones (Hitler) creates a need for a third category: the Divine Baby.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: He was born once unto us that we might be born forever unto him. He came down that we might go up.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is the 'new spirit' put within to replace the 'stony heart'—a total endowment of new competence.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Critical; sin is described as a 'stony heart' and 'soul sickness' that advice cannot fix.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a textbook example of a theocentric narrative where God is the Subject and humanity is the Receiver.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is the 'Grammar of Grace.'

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The opponent (Sin/Lynch rope) is already sufficiently terrifying.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon avoids the trap of 'Christmas moralism' by grounding the hope of the manger in the ontological necessity of a Savior rather than the ethical potential of humanity.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the vivid imagery of the lynch rope; Greimassian analysis shows that this imagery serves to define the 'Opponent' as insurmountable by human 'Subjects.'
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would explain the Greek of Luke 2; this analysis shows how the preacher assigns the 'Subject' role to Christ in a way that mirrors the 'Descent-Ascent' motif of Philippians 2.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the preacher systematically strips the hearer of 'Subject' status ('we are not able') to prepare them for 'Receiver' status.

volledige_subject_lijst: The Son (unrobed, strips, lays aside, descends, passes, gives)
appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'Hazard of Birth' as a narrative foil to highlight the 'Certainty of Grace.'
